formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Node Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the node where application server is to be created.

formElement.label: Server Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of application server to be created.

formElement.label: Generate Unique Ports?:
formElement.documentation: By default ports generated during server creation will be created uniquely. If not checked ports in template will be used as is for server creation.

formElement.label: Source Type:
formElement.documentation: Type of source which should be used for server creation. Select Template or Application Server. In case of template, application server template will be used for server creation, in case of Application Server, template will be created from existing application server and new server will be created from this template then. After successful creation template will be deleted.

formElement.label: Source Template Name:
formElement.documentation: This parameter is applicable only when the source is a Template. Name of server template to be the source for a new server.

formElement.label: Source Template Location:
formElement.documentation: The configuration Id that represents the location of a template. This parameter is applicable only when the source is a Template.

formElement.label: Source Server Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of application server to be the source for a new server in format nodename:servername.

formElement.label: Sync Nodes?:
formElement.documentation: The syncNode command forces a configuration synchronization to occur between the node and the deployment manager for the cell in which the node is configured.
